result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:35 AM Defendant Nicole Frances Bellanger appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Nicole Frances Bellanger.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Rosenthal asks for status in 45 days. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: Release to Center for Alcohol and Drug Treatment. Follow recommendations of treatment center. Sign information release to confirm presence at facility. No use or possession of drugs or paraphernalia

10:01 AM Defendant Nicole Frances Bellanger in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Nicole Frances Bellanger.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Rosenthal- client will waive prelim
Court finds probable cause, binds over for arraignment
Att Rosenthal- has agreement with State for her to do treatment. requests $750 signature bond, release to treatment staff
State-requests $1500 signature bond. Release her to Center for Alcohol and Drug Treatment in Duluth. Conditions of follow recommendations of traetment center and sign information release to verify presence at facility
Court orders bond and conditions. also condition of no drugs or paraph
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicole Frances Bellanger appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Nicole Frances Bellanger. Attorney Hoffman received complaint, waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. State requests $750 cash bail and conditions of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant has lack of local ties. Defendant has several fta's and probation violations out of Minnesota. Attorney Hoffman notes defendant lifelong resident of Duluth and is employed. Could post up to $200 cash bail. Court orders $750 cash bail and conditions of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Payment hearing pending scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
